comment._content: Time of war in Europe, I think. Excellent photo.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Lötzen (Lec in Polish), was a town in Germany's East Prussia located near the Germans' Eastern Front in WWI. After World War II, it was made part of Poland and is now known as Giżycko. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gi%C5%BCycko

comment.author: 33659611@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/76016463@N00]
Great research. Giżycko. Yes, I know this town. I think I even visited  it many years ago. History of East Prussia is intriguing. It was interesting to follow your link and read English text. Thank  you. :)
